snippet: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc said on Friday its second-quarter profit fell 37 percent, reflecting a significant decline in investment gains and an underwriting loss from insurance operations, which include Geico.
abstract: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc says second-quarter net income was $4.01 billion, or $2,442 per Class A share, down 37 percent from $6.4 billion, or $3,889 per share, in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 3 percent to $51.37 billion.
lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc said on Friday its second-quarter profit fell 37 percent, reflecting a significant decline in investment gains and an underwriting loss from insurance operations, which include Geico.

headline.main: Berkshire Profit Falls 37 Percent on Investment, Insurance Slump
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Berkshire Hathaway Reports 37% Drop in Profit
